New Records: Marcus Semien finished with five RBI and hit a 3-RUN HOMER
Key Match Events: The Texas Rangers hammered the Arizona Diamondbacks in Game 4 of the World Series, 11-7, taking a commanding 3-1 lead in the series
Four different Arizona relievers gave up a run or more
Marcus Semien, Corey Seager and Jonah Heim each homered on the night
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks came into the game with the intention of letting their bullpen handle the entire night
The Rangers took a jackhammer to that plan
Post-Match Reflections: The Diamondbacks will now have their three starters Zac Gallen, Merrill Kelly and Brandon Pfaadt available for the next three games
The Rangers will be without starting pitcher Max Scherzer and Adolis Garc√≠a for the rest of the World Series
The Diamondbacks are now just hoping to get this series back to Texas
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have been incredible on the road in October, winning 10 straight games away from home this postseason
The Diamondbacks' offense only mustered one run in their previous game
The Rangers continue to absolutely rake, with their sixth postseason game scoring seven or more runs
Others: Fans and pundits were happy to see the Diamondbacks get punished for utilizing a bullpen game in the World Series
The Rangers' aggressive approach to free agency and trades is a lesson to risk-averse MLB teams
